Assistant professor Dr. Md. Anwar Hossain, Cardiovascular and Thoracic Surgeon, graduated from Sir Salimullah Medical College, joined Cardiovascular surgery department of National Institute of Cardiovascular diseases as an assistant registrar in 2001. Later on he completed MS (CV&TS) and promoted as assistant professor.

He is an expert in the field of any type of Adult (CABG, Valve Replacement and Repair) and Congenital Cardiac Surgery including Surgical Correction of hole in the heart (ASD, VSD, PDA, AP Window), Surgical Correction of Complex Congenital Cardiac defects (total correction of TOF), different modalities of treatment of Coarctation of Aorta, single ventricle morphology, different types of palliative shunts , different types of total Anomalous Pulmonary Venous connection (TAPVC), AV Canal defects and Surgery for Ebsteinâ€™s Anomaly of Tricuspid Valve. He is regularly doing Beating Heart Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting (CABG) and Mitral, Aortic, Tricuspid Valve repair and replacement.

As a member of Comprehensive Cardiac and vascular team, he managed many complex scenarios especially retrieving emblazed devices used for PDA, ASD & VSD Closure and Simultaneous Surgical Correction of desired defects and also vascular and thoracic cases.
